Addr.description:
A human readable address.

In Cosmos, this is typically bech32 encoded. But for multi-chain smart contracts no assumptions should be made other than being UTF-8 encoded and of reasonable length.

This type represents a validated address. It can be created in the following ways 1. Use `Addr::unchecked(input)` 2. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_validate(input)?` 3. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_humanize(canonical_addr)?` 4. Deserialize from JSON. This must only be done from JSON that was validated before such as a contract's state. `Addr` must not be used in messages sent by the user because this would result in unvalidated instances.

This type is immutable. If you really need to mutate it (Really? Are you sure?), create a mutable copy using `let mut mutable = Addr::to_string()` and operate on that `String` instance.

AssetInfo.description: This enum describes available Token types. ## Examples ``` # use cosmwasm_std::Addr; # use astroport::asset::AssetInfo::{NativeToken, Token}; Token { contract_addr: Addr::unchecked("stake...") }; NativeToken { denom: String::from("uluna") }; ```

oneOf.description: Non-native Token
Native token

fee.description: To make things easier we avoid CW20 fee tokens

fee_receiver.description: Fee receiver can be either a contract or a wallet.

oneOf.description: Setup generators with their respective allocation points. Only the owner or generator controller can execute this.

pools.description: The list of pools with allocation point.

oneOf.description: Update rewards and return it to user.

lp_tokens.description: The LP token cw20 address or token factory denom

oneOf.description: Receives a message of type [`Cw20ReceiveMsg`]. Handles cw20 LP token deposits.
Stake LP tokens in the Generator. LP tokens staked on behalf of recipient if recipient is set. Otherwise LP tokens are staked on behalf of message sender.
Withdraw LP tokens from the Generator

amount.description: The amount to withdraw. Must not exceed total staked amount.

lp_token.description: The LP token cw20 address or token factory denom

oneOf.description: Set a new amount of ASTRO to distribute per seconds. Only the owner can execute this.

amount.description: The new amount of ASTRO to distribute per second

oneOf.description: Incentivize a pool with external rewards. Rewards can be in either native or cw20 form. Incentivizor must send incentivization fee along with rewards (if this reward token is new in this pool). 3rd parties are encouraged to keep endless schedules without breaks even with the small rewards. Otherwise, reward token will be removed from the pool info and go to outstanding rewards. Next schedules with the same token will be considered as "new". NOTE: Sender must approve allowance for cw20 reward tokens to this contract.

lp_token.description: The LP token cw20 address or token factory denom

oneOf.description: Remove specific reward token from the pool. Only the owner can execute this.

bypass_upcoming_schedules.description: If there is too much spam in the state, owner can bypass upcoming schedules; Tokens from these schedules will stuck in Generator balance forever. Set true only in emergency cases i.e. if deregistration message hits gas limit during simulation. Default: false

lp_token.description: The LP token cw20 address or token factory denom

reward.description: The reward token cw20 address or token factory denom

oneOf.description: Claim all or up to the limit accumulated orphaned rewards. Only the owner can execute this.
Update config. Only the owner can execute it.

generator_controller.description: The new generator controller contract address

oneOf.description: Add or remove token to the block list. Only owner or guardian can execute this. Pools which contain these tokens can't be incentivized with ASTRO rewards. Also blocked tokens can't be used as external reward. Current active pools with these tokens will be removed from active set.
Only factory can set the allocation points to zero for the specified pool. Initiated from deregistration context in factory.
Go through active pools and deactivate the ones which pair type is blocked
Creates a request to change contract ownership Only the current owner can execute this.

expires_in.description: The validity period of the proposal to change the contract owner

oneOf.description: Removes a request to change contract ownership Only the current owner can execute this
Claims contract ownership Only the newly proposed owner can execute this

Addr.description:
A human readable address.

In Cosmos, this is typically bech32 encoded. But for multi-chain smart contracts no assumptions should be made other than being UTF-8 encoded and of reasonable length.

This type represents a validated address. It can be created in the following ways 1. Use `Addr::unchecked(input)` 2. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_validate(input)?` 3. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_humanize(canonical_addr)?` 4. Deserialize from JSON. This must only be done from JSON that was validated before such as a contract's state. `Addr` must not be used in messages sent by the user because this would result in unvalidated instances.

This type is immutable. If you really need to mutate it (Really? Are you sure?), create a mutable copy using `let mut mutable = Addr::to_string()` and operate on that `String` instance.

Asset.description: This enum describes a Terra asset (native or CW20).

info.description: Information about an asset stored in a [`AssetInfo`] struct

AssetInfo.description: This enum describes available Token types. ## Examples ``` # use cosmwasm_std::Addr; # use astroport::asset::AssetInfo::{NativeToken, Token}; Token { contract_addr: Addr::unchecked("stake...") }; NativeToken { denom: String::from("uluna") }; ```

oneOf.description: Non-native Token
Native token

Binary.description:
Binary is a wrapper around Vec<u8> to add base64 de/serialization with serde. It also adds some helper methods to help encode inline.

This is only needed as serde-json-{core,wasm} has a horrible encoding for Vec<u8>. See also <https://github.com/CosmWasm/cosmwasm/blob/main/docs/MESSAGE_TYPES.md>.

Cw20ReceiveMsg.description: Cw20ReceiveMsg should be de/serialized under `Receive()` variant in a ExecuteMsg

fee.description: To make things easier we avoid CW20 fee tokens

fee_receiver.description: Fee receiver can be either a contract or a wallet.

oneOf.description: Config returns the main contract parameters
Deposit returns the LP token amount deposited in a specific generator
PendingToken returns the amount of rewards that can be claimed by an account that deposited a specific LP token in a generator
RewardInfo returns reward information for a specified LP token
PoolInfo returns information about a pool associated with the specified LP token
Returns a list of tuples with addresses and their staked amount
Returns paginated list of blocked tokens
Checks whether fee expected for the specified pool if user wants to add new reward schedule
Returns the list of all external reward schedules for the specified LP token
Returns the list of all ever incentivized pools
Returns the list of all pools receiving astro emissions

Native token

astro_per_second.description: Total amount of ASTRO rewards per second

generator_controller.description: Contract address which can only set active generators and their alloc points

guardian.description: The guardian address which can add or remove tokens from blacklist

incentivization_fee_info.description: Defines native fee along with fee receiver. Fee is paid on adding NEW external reward to a specific pool

owner.description: Address allowed to change contract parameters

total_alloc_points.description: Total allocation points. Must be the sum of all allocation points in all active generators

vesting_contract.description: The vesting contract which distributes internal (ASTRO) rewards

deposit.title: Uint128

Decimal256.description:
A fixed-point decimal value with 18 fractional digits, i.e. Decimal256(1_000_000_000_000_000_000) == 1.0

The greatest possible value that can be represented is 115792089237316195423570985008687907853269984665640564039457.584007913129639935 (which is (2^256 - 1) / 10^18)

oneOf.description: Non-native Token
Native token

last_update_ts.description: Last time when reward indexes were updated

rewards.description: Vector contains reward info for each reward token

total_lp.description: Total amount of LP tokens staked in this pool

oneOf.description: Non-native Token
Native token

Decimal256.description:
A fixed-point decimal value with 18 fractional digits, i.e. Decimal256(1_000_000_000_000_000_000) == 1.0

The greatest possible value that can be represented is 115792089237316195423570985008687907853269984665640564039457.584007913129639935 (which is (2^256 - 1) / 10^18)

index.description: Last checkpointed reward per LP token

orphaned.description: Orphaned rewards might appear between the time when pool gets incentivized and the time when first user stakes

reward.description: Defines [`AssetInfo`] of reward token as well as its type: protocol or external.

rps.description: Reward tokens per second for the whole pool

RewardType.description: This enum is a tiny wrapper over [`AssetInfo`] to differentiate between internal and external rewards. External rewards always have a next_update_ts field which is used to update reward per second (or disable them).

oneOf.description: Internal rewards aka ASTRO emissions don't have next_update_ts field and they are paid out from Vesting contract.
External rewards always have corresponding schedules. Reward is paid out from Generator contract balance.

next_update_ts.description: Time when next schedule should start
